title.narrative: Provision of lifesaving integrated Sexual and Reproductive Health (SRH) services and information including clinical management of rape for GBV survivors -drought affected women and adolescent girls.

description.narrative: The objective of this $500,000 UNFPA project is the provision of life-saving sexual and reproductive health services for drought-affected women and girls, including the clinical management of rape for gender-based violence survivors. With CERF funding, UNFPA will enable 4,827 births to be assisted by a skilled health professional, provide 6,113 primary healthcare consultations and deliver 45 emergency reproductive health kits to health facilities. UNFPA will also conduct mobile outreach and information campaigns to increase awareness on prevention and access to services. 644 women and girls are expected to benefit from core GBV services (case management, psycho-social support, clinical management of rape, etc.). In total, UNFPA aims to reach 24,296 people, including 20,652 women and 2,429 girls.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

Provision of lifesaving emergency obstetric and newborn care (EmONC) services for vulnerable women and girls in drought affected regions
H.8 Number of primary healthcare consultations provided (focusing pregnancy related complications and family planning counselling)

SP.2a Number of inter-agency emergency reproductive health kits delivered (Number of ERH kits procured)
